conversations.message: Happy New Year, Rohan. January plan is live. Goals: tighten adherence (≥60% home weeks), maintain minimums during travel, and prep for February full diagnostics. Tentative travel: Jakarta Jan 22–26—please confirm with Sarah.
Week 1 cadence reminder: Monday check-in, Friday micro-report. Exercise refresh scheduled Jan 13, 6:15 PM SGT.
This week’s focus: 2 strength + 2 Zone 2 minimum, 1 optional intervals if sleep ≥6h45m. I’ve muted late-night reminders due to your evening calls.
I’ll shift reminders to WIB during the trip and preload hotel workouts. Also setting a gentle step goal: 8,000/day on high-meeting days.
Welcome to Jakarta. I’ll schedule Zone 2 early mornings Fri/Sun and a minimum strength circuit tonight if dinner runs late.

journey.title: New Year Reset & Intensification
journey.summary: New Year Reset & Intensification - 50 messages, 3 decisions

conversations.message: Confirming Jakarta Jan 22–26. Meetings mostly afternoon/evening. Hotel has a basic gym.
Thanks—let’s push hard this month.
January nutrition reset:
Sleep & HRV reset:
Any knee feedback after the holidays?
Knee’s fine. Hips felt tight after flights; better now.
Add 90/90 hip flow + couch stretch 8–10 min nightly this week. Strength sessions on Mon/Thu, Zone 2 Tue/Sat.
Quick question—does cutting carbs at dinner help ApoB or just weight?

ApoB reduction is more sensitive to overall saturated fat quality, fiber intake, weight loss (if applicable), and total LDL particle production rather than dinner carb timing alone. Your current focus on fiber, omega-3s, and overall dietary pattern will support ApoB. Carb timing can help sleep and glycemic control.
Good. I’ll aim for Zone 2 today.
Seeing improved sleep efficiency on nights with earlier dinners and breathwork. Maintain caffeine cut-off; HRV trending slightly up vs late December.
Reading about beetroot juice for cardio performance. Worth trying for Zone 2 or intervals?
It can support nitric oxide pathways; mostly helps higher-intensity work. Safe to try 250–500ml 2–3h pre-intervals 1–2x/week. We’ll monitor GI tolerance.
Any discomfort with RDLs or step-ups?
No pain. Step-ups feel strong. Ready to progress cautiously.
Friday micro-report:
Copy. Will try intervals Sunday morning if sleep cooperates.
Question—can I stack creatine with beetroot on interval days?
Yes—no known negative interaction. Take creatine in the morning; beetroot juice 2–3h pre-intervals. Hydrate well.
Perfect for travel. Will be in Jakarta Jan 22–26.
BP spot-check protocol this week and next: 2 mornings/week, seated after 5 minutes rest, no caffeine 30 minutes prior. Share averages with Ruby.
BP this morning 124/78; last week was 126/80. Feels stable.
Good trend. Maintain sodium awareness during client dinners; hydration and sleep remain key levers.
Friday micro-report:
Great. I’ll aim for 2 sessions this weekend.
Science question—does sauna raise BP acutely?

In the sauna, heart rate and skin blood flow increase; BP can initially rise slightly then often decreases post-session due to vasodilation. Keep sessions moderate (10–15 min), avoid if dehydrated, and allow cool-down. Not right before bed.
Landed. Meetings stacked this afternoon and evening. Gym has DBs and treadmills.
Late dinner. Doing the 10-minute minimum now.
Minimum set:
Zone 2 35 minutes on treadmill. HR a bit higher than home.
Travel HR drift is expected. Keep nasal-breathing pace, hydrate, and get morning light.
Skipped creatine today; took omega-3.
Noted—resume creatine in the morning. Travel organizer seems to be reducing misses overall—good trend.
Sleep 5h50m; HRV dipped.
Keep intensity low today. Try a 20–25 min easy walk outdoors + breathwork tonight. Expect HRV rebound in 24–48h.
Managed Zone 2 again. Dinner was late but lighter.
Great—protein + veg first and sparkling water pre-meal remains the move.
Welcome home. I’ll consolidate Month 5 summary tomorrow and pencil your February full diagnostic (week of Feb 10). Preferences for days?
Tue or Wed mornings best.
Full diagnostic panel held for Wed Feb 11, 7:30 AM SGT at Orchard clinic (fasting from 10 PM prior). Post-lab review with Dr. Warren on Fri Feb 13, 6:30 PM SGT. I’ll share prep notes next week.
Book it. Thanks.
Post-travel read: HRV is rebounding; resting HR elevated ~2 bpm vs pre-trip—normal. Keep Zone 2 today and an earlier dinner target.
Any joint niggles after travel?
All good. Step-ups still feel stable.
Chef rotation for Feb to support ApoB push:
Month 5 Summary (Executive):
Great—clear and executable. Let’s hit February hard.
Strong January, Rohan—momentum is on your side. We’ll keep the friction low and focus on compounding simple wins ahead of the lab checkpoint.
Closing Month 5. I’ll send lab prep notes on Feb 9 and coordinate anything needed via Sarah.
Updated plan:
Jakarta meal swaps reminder:

journey.title: Medication Introduction & Strategy Update
journey.summary: Medication Introduction & Strategy Update - 47 messages, 7 decisions

conversations.message: Happy February, Rohan. This month: exercise refresh on Feb 10 (light), full diagnostics Feb 11 (7:30 AM, Orchard clinic; fasting from 10 PM Feb 10), Dr. Warren review Feb 13 (6:30 PM). I’ll send lab prep notes on Feb 9.
Thanks, Ruby. Let’s keep the week clean ahead of labs.
Suggest a 15–20% volume reduction Feb 8–12 to get a clean recovery read. Keep two Zone 2 sessions and one strength early in the week.
Pre-lab nutrition: maintain your standard meals, fiber, and omega-3; avoid alcohol Feb 9–10; keep dinner earlier on Feb 10 if possible.
Any knee or hip feedback after January travel?
Knee stable. No pain >2/10. Hips feel fine with nightly mobility.
Travel this month? Any APAC/US trips we should account for?
Light month—possible UK trip last week Feb 24–28; TBC by Feb 15.
Quick Q—should I pause creatine before labs?
No need to pause creatine for standard panels. Continue as normal. Focus on sleep and hydration.
Friday micro-report:
Lab prep for Feb 11:
All good.
Last meal 7:30 PM, water only after. Light mobility done.
Good morning—clinic is ready for you. Text if anything needed.
Labs done. Back to office.
Keep training easy to moderate next 24–48h. Aim for an early dinner and a 10-minute wind-down tonight for good recovery.
Thanks for joining, Rohan. Here’s the 6-month read:
Understood. If we start low-dose statin, what does monitoring look like?

We’ll check repeat lipids, ApoB, and liver enzymes at 6–8 weeks to confirm response and tolerance, then roll into your next quarterly panel in May. Report any muscle symptoms or unusual fatigue; we can adjust dose or switch agents if needed.

No change to nutrition fundamentals: 30–40g protein breakfast, oily fish 3x/week, ≥30g fiber with psyllium at lunch, and alcohol ≤2/week. Maintain chef rotations and late-dinner strategies during travel.
Fine with that. Let’s proceed.
With statin initiation, keep a steady training load this week—2 Zone 2 + 2 strength—and watch for any unusual soreness. HRV trends should remain stable.
If you notice muscle soreness beyond your baseline after starting medication, flag it. We can modulate volume/intensity while Dr. Warren assesses.
Received. Will start tomorrow morning.
First dose taken. Normal day planned—Zone 2 this evening.
Sounds good. Keep it easy-moderate tonight; aim for an earlier dinner to support sleep.
UK trip confirmed Feb 24–28 (London). Hotels with basic gyms booked.
UK food strategy:
Quick knee/hip check before travel?
All good. Step-ups still comfortable.
Travel HRV plan:
Landed. Will do a 20-minute walk before meetings.
Dinner ran late. Doing the minimum now.

Slept 5h50m. Zone 2 or rest?
Keep Zone 2 but cap at RPE 4/10 for 30–35 minutes. Get daylight later in the morning between meetings.
Supplements on track including statin. No soreness so far.
Excellent. Keep hydration high and maintain protein at breakfast to reduce late-day cravings.
Final dinner tonight. Will keep carbs light.
Perfect—protein + veg first, sauces on side, and sparkling water pre-meal.
Welcome home, Rohan. Quick tolerance check: any muscle pain or unusual fatigue since starting the statin?
No issues so far. Energy good.
Great. We’ll plan a focused lipid/ApoB + liver enzymes check in late March to confirm response, then roll into the next full panel in May.
Month 6 Summary (Executive):
Excellent. Let’s keep the momentum and see how ApoB responds in March.
Strong month—decisive step on long-term risk while preserving your lifestyle rhythm. We’ll stay proactive and low-friction into March.

Results in 48–72 hours. Review this Friday as scheduled.
I’ll coordinate prescription and delivery to your home by Tuesday, and set calendar reminders for morning dosing. Sarah looped for any travel overlaps.
Medication delivery confirmed for today 5–7 PM. Dosing reminder set for 8:00 AM daily starting tomorrow. I’ve also scheduled a quick tolerance check-in call next week.
I’ll time-shift reminders to GMT and preload hotel workouts. Flight-day protocol and sauna guidelines will be sent on Feb 23.
Travel checklist sent (bands, sachets, electrolytes, statin reminders synced to local time). I’ll switch reminder timezone as you board.
Reminders now on GMT. Hotel gym verified. I’ve scheduled Zone 2 early mornings and a 10-minute minimum set for late nights.

Good morning, Rohan. March plan is live. Key dates: Exercise refresh Mar 10 (6:15 PM SGT). Focused lipid/ApoB + LFT check Mar 26 (7:30 AM, Orchard clinic; fasting). Tentative Seoul trip Mar 18–22—confirm with Sarah.
Travel pack prepped: supplement organizer, protein sachets, bands, electrolytes. Reminders will shift to KST. I’ll preload hotel workouts and step-goal nudges (8,000/day).
Welcome to Seoul. Morning Zone 2 scheduled Thu/Sat; late-night minimums preloaded if dinners run late.
Results expected within 48–72 hours. I’ll schedule a short results call with Dr. Warren early next week.
Confirming Seoul Mar 18–22. Hotel gym available; meetings heavy evenings.
Thanks—let’s keep cognitive/energy solid this month.
Cognition protocol (Weeks 1–2):
Fuel for focus:
No pain >2/10. Step-ups feel strong. Hinge stable.
Garmin flagged low HRV last night after a late dinner. Keep Zone 2 or rest?
Do easy Zone 2 tomorrow—RPE 4/10, 30–35 minutes. Early dinner tonight if possible; wind-down and cooler room temp.
Friday micro-report (pulled forward due to your Thursday travel call):
Perfect timing for Seoul. Will need late-night minimums during dinners.
Quick question—any interaction between statin and beetroot juice on intervals?
No known clinically significant interaction. Maintain hydration; report any unusual muscle soreness. Intervals only on well-rested days while traveling.

Keep Zone 2 easy—30–35 minutes at RPE 4/10, nasal breathing. Daylight walk between meetings.

Welcome home. I’ll push a light consolidation tomorrow and prep for Mar 26 labs.

Acknowledged.
Last meal 7:40 PM. Light mobility done.
Good morning—clinic is ready. Ping me for anything.
Labs done. Back to work.
Keep training easy-moderate today; aim for earlier dinner and 10–12 min wind-down for good recovery.
That’s great news. No side effects so far.
Perfect. Continue current dosing and report any new symptoms promptly.
Month 7 Summary (Executive):
Appreciate the tight execution this month—results speak for themselves.
Excellent milestone, Rohan. The combination of targeted lifestyle upgrades and measured pharmacology is paying off. We’ll keep the system low-friction into April and prepare for the May deep-dive.
Any knee/hip flags before we progress on Mar 10?
Great. Keep current plan this week: 2 strength (Mon/Thu), 2 Zone 2 (Tue/Sat). Intervals only if sleep ≥6h45m.

Yes, if timed well. Keep naps 20–30 minutes before 3 PM; avoid if it disrupts nightly sleep. On travel, use them to buffer time-zone fatigue.
If napping, have a light protein-forward lunch to avoid post-meal slumps; hydrate; no caffeine after 2 PM.

SF dining swaps: protein + veg first; sauces on side; if dessert is social, share and keep to 2–3 bites. No nightcap.

journey.title: Medical Review & Strategic Planning
journey.summary: Medical Review & Strategic Planning - 2 messages, 1 decisions

conversations.message: Hi Rohan. Let’s review your goals and risk profile. I note family history of heart disease. We’ll target cholesterol, BP, inflammation, and cognitive performance. I’m ordering the comprehensive baseline diagnostic panel next week—this is your Month 0 baseline. We’ll repeat a full panel every 3 months to track progress.
Perfect. I’ll summarize actions after labs. Minimal immediate changes: maintain your current routines for clean baseline.
Absolutely—hotel-room friendly, minimal equipment. Your first 2-week block will include: split squats, push-ups (tempo), suitcase deadlift (single DB), plank breathing, and 90/90 hip flow.
Nice work. Focus on slow eccentrics and 2-second pause at the bottom of split squats. Send a form video next week if possible.
We’ll regress split squats depth; add isometric wall sit 3x30s and TKE band work. Send a 10-second stair descent video if possible.
Weeks 5–6 Plan:
We’ll add a 2-minute option: high-protein yogurt cup + pre-cut berries + 1 tbsp nuts. Keep 3 ready cups in the fridge.
Understood. Low-friction swap: add 2 boiled eggs or yogurt alongside; keeps protein up and stabilizes energy.
Traveling to London Sat–Thu next week. Time zones will be fun.
Rohan, thanks for waiting. Baseline highlights:
Clear. What’s the implication of elevated Lp(a)?

It’s a genetically influenced marker that increases cardiovascular risk independent of LDL-C. We manage via aggressive LDL/ApoB reduction, lifestyle optimization, and potential pharmacotherapy later. We’ll tailor based on your next panel and response.
Starting home BP today.
Great. Please measure seated, after 5 minutes rest, no caffeine 30 minutes before; log morning and evening for 7 days.
UK hotel breakfast tips:
Noted. Also, any view on dark chocolate at night?
Fine in 1–2 squares 70%+ cacao; avoid within 2 hours of sleep to minimize caffeine impact.
Exercise refresh (Weeks 3–4):
HRV improved slightly after 2 PM caffeine cut-off. Sleep latency down by ~6–10 minutes past 3 nights. Keep this going in UK if possible.
Landed. Jet lag is mild. Did 25-min Zone 2 on treadmill.
Meetings stacked; breakfast was a croissant. I’ll try to adjust tomorrow.
Skipping strength today—late dinner.
No worries. Convert to a 10-minute “minimum effective dose”:
BP travel readings slightly higher. Might be salt?
Likely a combo of sleep disruption, higher sodium, and flight stress. We’ll look at the 7-day average when you’re back. Continue logging; prioritize hydration and early dinner.
Read about time-restricted eating helping lipids. Worth trying?
It can help by reducing late-night intake and total energy, improving insulin sensitivity for some. Let’s pilot a gentle 12:12 window after you return to Singapore, not during travel week.
Mid-month weekly report (Summarized):
Got it. Will do 10-minute minimum tonight.
Question—does sauna help HRV?

For many, yes—sauna can support relaxation and parasympathetic tone if used earlier in the day or several hours before bed. If hotel has one and you’re recovered, 10–15 minutes at low-moderate heat is fine.
Welcome back. Tomorrow I’ll push a consolidated Month 1 summary and your Week 5–6 updates.
Back on local time. Did Zone 2 outdoors; felt good.
Nice. We refresh exercises tomorrow. Any joint niggles?
Slight right knee discomfort on stairs.
Month 1 Summary (Exec):
Looks good. Let’s lock it.
Chef menu refresh sent:
Another nerdy question—what’s the signal we’re looking for in ApoB reduction? Percent change or absolute?

Both matter. Our aim is to push ApoB to a lower risk zone given your Lp(a). We’ll assess absolute level and trend. If lifestyle plus diet is insufficient by Month 3–6, we’ll discuss additional therapies.
HRV trendline stabilized post-travel; training load is appropriate. Keep Zone 2 today and early dinner. Expect better sleep efficiency tonight.
Closing Month 1—great start, Rohan. October calendar:
Good morning, Rohan. Kicking off October. Quick reminders: Monday check-ins, Friday micro-reports, exercise refresh on Oct 14, and US trip late month. Will coordinate with Sarah for time zones.
Confirming exercise refresh with Rachel on Oct 14 at 6:15 PM SGT. US trip: Oct 21–28 to New York and San Francisco. Sarah looped for local times.
Noted. Switching reminders to EDT. Keep dinner lighter, halve carbs, and aim for a 10-minute wind-down.
Transit day to SF—reminders shifting to PT at your local time on arrival. Hydrate and walk during layover if possible.
Thanks, Ruby. Let’s keep it tight. I’m aiming for 2 Zone 2 + 2 strength this week.
Better. Low-box step-ups feel fine. Mild discomfort only when rushing.
Keep the reduced ROM goblet squats. Add isometric wall sit 3x30s post-session. Log any pain >3/10.
Chef confirms salmon bowls Mon/Thu and yogurt cups Sun/Tue. Travel snack kit is stocked at home. Any friction points?
Late dinners happen 2–3 nights/week. Hard to avoid with work.
Quick Q—does afternoon sunlight actually help sleep?
Yes—15–20 minutes outdoor light in the first half of the day improves circadian anchoring. On travel weeks, use this aggressively to fight time-zone drift.
Friday micro-report:
Locked in. Zone 2 tomorrow morning.
Confirmed. Please send any travel-specific guidance by Oct 18.
Reading about creatine for cognition—worth considering?
Generally safe and may support cognition and training. Let’s start at 3–5g/day, preferably earlier in the day to avoid any GI discomfort near bedtime. Carla will integrate into your plan.
Garmin shows HRV dip after late dinner. Coincidence?
Not a coincidence for many—late meals elevate overnight HR and reduce HRV. Keep the “half carbs after 9 PM” rule and aim to finish dinner 2–3 hours before bed when possible.
Ahead of the Oct 14 refresh—how’s the hinge pattern? Any back tightness?
Hinge to wall feels good. No back pain. Grip strength feels slightly better.
Friday micro-report:
Understood. I’ll get both in.
Looks good. I’ll be in hotels next week—will adapt.
US time-zone protocol:
Travel food plan:
I’ll try a 12:12 eating window after travel—okay?
Yes—great to start post-travel. We’ll compare HRV and resting HR week over week.

Start with Zone 2 35–40 min today to flush flight fatigue. Strength A tomorrow if sleep is ≥6h.
Dinner meeting ran late. Skipping strength.

Knee fine. Sleep 5h45m. Caffeine at 2 PM local time as planned.
Good. Expect HRV to be lower during travel—aim for consistency, not perfection. Daylight walk again today.

For late dinners: protein + veg, skip bread/basket, sparkling water first, and if dessert is mandatory socially, share and take 2–3 bites.

Yes if you’re not too depleted; keep it 10–12 minutes, earlier in the evening, followed by a cool shower and gentle mobility. Avoid right before bed.
Managed Zone 2 this morning. Feeling better.
Excellent. Optional: 2 sets suitcase carry if dumbbells available; otherwise, brisk 10-minute incline finish.
Final client dinner went long. Only walked today.
That’s okay—travel standard applies. Tomorrow’s flight home: aim for an aisle stretch every 90 minutes and 500ml water per 3 hours.
Welcome home, Rohan. I’ll push your Month 2 summary and Week 9–10 updates tomorrow. Also blocking your November full diagnostic the week of Nov 11—fasting morning slot at Orchard clinic.
Book it. Prefer Tue or Wed morning.
Held Wed Nov 12, 7:30 AM SGT. Fasting from 10 PM the night before. I’ll send prep notes.
Post-travel read: HRV is rebounding; resting HR elevated by ~2–3 bpm vs pre-trip—typical. Keep Zone 2 today, earlier dinner, and 10-minute wind-down.
Any friction on supplements while traveling?
Missed omega-3 and creatine 3 days in SF.
Understood. We’ll set a travel capsule organizer and a nightly “supplement check” reminder for future trips.
Any knee flare after the trip?
Solid. Step-ups felt stable. Ready to progress cautiously next refresh.

Thanks, team. Let’s push ApoB and inflammation down this quarter.
I’ll coordinate all logistics and keep friction low. Have a great weekend, Rohan.
Great target. Mini-experiment: maintain 2 PM caffeine cut-off and add 5-minute evening nasal breathing before the wind-down. I’ll watch HRV and sleep efficiency shifts.
How’s the right knee on stairs after last week’s regressions?
Excellent. We’ll progress hinge depth slightly and add suitcase carry distance. Keeping knee-friendly options.
Updated plan:
Strategy: If dinner after 9 PM, halve the carb portion, add sparkling water, and close the kitchen 2 hours before bed. We’ll test impact on sleep and HR.

Approved. Psyllium is new—let’s try.
Cardio/strength upgrade (Weeks 11–12):
HRV has normalized post-Seoul; resting HR trending back to pre-trip. Stay with Zone 2 today and earlier dinner. Expect a good sleep window tonight.
Closing Month 3—nice work staying consistent through travel. I’ll keep December logistics crisp and time-zone aware.
Weekly plan posted: reminders Mon check-in, Fri micro-report. Confirming no travel first two weeks; potential Korea trip late month?
Results in 48–72 hours. Friday review as scheduled.
Good call. Add herbal tea 60–90 minutes pre-bed and keep kitchen closed 2 hours before lights out.
Chef rotation updated; adding sardines on toast (whole-grain) once weekly and a legume-forward dinner once weekly. Travel protein sachets and supplement organizer delivered by Monday.
Post-lab training for the next 48 hours: return to normal routine, but keep first strength session moderate. Focus on tempo and form.

journey.title: Medical Review & Strategic Planning
journey.summary: Medical Review & Strategic Planning - 1 messages, 1 decisions

conversations.message: That’s acceptable. We’ll set an aggressive but feasible plan, monitor adherence, and re-evaluate in February labs. If ApoB remains elevated, we’ll revisit pharmacotherapy then.
Good morning, Rohan. December plan is live. Key dates: Exercise refresh Dec 9 (6:15 PM SGT), QBR with Neel Dec 18 (6:30 PM SGT). Tentative Jakarta trip Dec 11–15 as per Sarah—please confirm.
Travel pack ready at home: supplement organizer, protein sachets, electrolytes, mini resistance band. Reminders will auto-shift to WIB.
Holiday week schedule posted. Reminders will be lighter, focused on minimums and Zone 2 opportunities.
Merry Christmas! Enjoy the day. I’ll keep reminders minimal.
Month-end admin—confirming no further travel until Jan 5. I’ll share the December summary and January plan tomorrow.
Confirmed—Jakarta Dec 11–15, back late night Dec 15.
Thanks. December will be social—lots of dinners. Let’s keep it pragmatic.
Holiday strategy:
Cognition focus for long days:
Knee check-in?
Stable. No pain >2/10. Flights sometimes stiffen hips.
Garmin shows HRV slightly lower past two nights—late dinners.
Expected. Use the 1-plate rule + earlier finish when possible. Push a 20–30-minute Zone 2 today to nudge recovery.
Friday micro-report (pulled forward):
Looks good. Will be in Jakarta from Thursday.
Landed. Gym is basic—DBs and treadmills.
Perfect. Use Strength A hotel variant tomorrow if sleep ≥6h; Zone 2 today for 35–40 minutes.
Client dinner heavy on sauces. Skipping rice helped. Heading for a 10-minute minimum.
Minimum set:
Sleep 6h05m. HRV a bit low. Zone 2 or rest?
Keep Zone 2 but cap at RPE 4/10, 30–35 minutes. Focus on nasal breathing. Hydrate well.
Missed creatine yesterday. Took omega-3 both days.
Noted. Travel organizer is helping overall—good adherence. Resume creatine tomorrow morning.
Welcome back. QBR with Neel on Dec 18, 6:30 PM SGT. I’ll circulate an executive pre-read tomorrow.
QBR Pre-Read (Executive):
Appreciate the framing. Let’s keep it simple and executable.
Echoing Neel—if ApoB remains above target in February, we’ll discuss low-dose statin or alternatives, balancing your preferences and risk profile.
Holiday-specific tweaks effective Dec 20–Jan 2:
December training guardrails:
If HRV dips after late nights, keep intensity low next day and favor outdoor light + walking. Rebound usually within 24–48 hours.
Thanks—lots of family events this week. Expect 50% adherence.
Big dinner. Skipped alcohol. HRV probably tanks.
Good call on alcohol. Do a 10-minute breathwork wind-down, cool shower, and sleep in a darker room tonight if possible.
If time permits, 15-minute hotel/house circuit:
Merry Christmas, team. I’ll do a Zone 2 this afternoon.
Friday micro-report:
Question—does psyllium timing matter on party days?
Prefer with lunch daily; if a heavy dinner is expected, an extra 1/2 tsp with water 30–45 minutes before can help satiety (only if GI tolerance is good).
Did 40 minutes Zone 2. Felt solid.
HRV rebounding; resting HR normalizing. Maintain 2 PM caffeine cut-off; expect better sleep efficiency tonight.
Month 4 Summary (Executive):
Thanks all—good balance this month. Let’s push hard in January.
Agreed. January is our runway to make a strong case on ApoB before February’s panel.
Nice work navigating constraints without losing momentum, Rohan. We’ll keep the system low-friction and targeted on what moves the needle.
Happy New Year’s Eve to you and family. I’ll keep notifications muted tonight—back on Jan 2 with a crisp plan.
Add plane mobility: ankle pumps x30, knee extensions x12, seated spinal rotations x6/side every 60–90 minutes. Post-flight 90/90s x8.
Updated plan:
Great. Keep tomorrow light mobility and a 10-minute minimum if short on time.
Jakarta dining swaps:
Family meal swaps:
Rohan, great to connect. At a high level:
